item.title: Community reacts to ICE shooting in Minnesota. And, RFK Jr. unveils new food pyramid
item.description: Minnesota law enforcement and the FBI are investigating an ICE officer's fatal shooting of a Minneapolis woman. And, Health Secretary RFK Jr. unveils new dietary guidelines for Americans.

item.title: A Supreme Court ruling could bring historic drop in Black representation in Congress
item.description: If the Supreme Court weakens Voting Rights Act protections against racial discrimination in redistricting, it could usher in the largest-ever drop in representation by Black members of Congress.
item.content:encoded:

item.title: In Lodge Grass, Montana, a Crow community works to rebuild from meth's destruction
item.description: Meth is a problem most everywhere, but particularly in Indian Country. In one small town on the Crow Indian Reservation in Montana, new buildings serve as symbols of a town trying to rebuild after being devastated by addiction.

item.title: House to vote on renewing ACA subsidies as a potential deal takes shape in the Senate
item.description: While the three-year extension for Affordable Care Act subsidies is expected to pass the House, it may not go far in the Senate. But a bipartisan group of senators say they are close on a compromise.

item.title: 2 killed in shooting outside Mormon church in Salt Lake City
item.description: Two people were killed and six others injured in a shooting outside a Salt Lake City church Wednesday night while mourners were attending a memorial service inside, police said.

item.title: Trump invites Colombian president to White House after threatening his country with military strike
item.description: President Donald Trump abruptly changed his tone Wednesday about his Colombian counterpart, Gustavo Petro, saying they had exchanged a friendly phone call and he'd even invited the leader of the South American country to the White House.

item.title: Rep. Steny Hoyer, the longest-serving House Democrat, to retire at the end of term
item.description: The Democrat from Maryland is the longest-serving Democrat in Congress, and was once a rival to become House speaker. Hoyer will announce Thursday he is set to retire at the end of his term.
